Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in downtown Napa”
Reviews.Author: EHT1505
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and it’s a great value. You cannot beat the location. It’s a short walk to all of the restaurants/shops in downtown napa. The place is clean, the beds are comfortable and there is free parking at the hotel. The rooms are a bit small, but have everything you need for a great price. A big shout out to Gary who runs the hotel. He is a very friendly guy who will help you with whatever you need. We will be back, if for no other reason than to be entertained by Gary.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: c b
Reviews.Content: came to see show at uptown (1 block away)Was leery about hotel after reading reviews-polite helpful staff ,newly renovated rooms,comfortable bed Great location walking distance to everything,After we got home we realize we left suitcase at hotel staff went above and beyond to help ship bag back to us thank you Gary.next time i go to Napa i am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Gamyleigh
Reviews.Content: I can understand how this hotel has such mixed reviews. I saw first hand how the rooms differ greatly. I tried to book with the hotel directly, but they had no King with jacuzzi available so I booked with an online site. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The room we were given was dark (the wall was actually painted dark grey), there is a metal rack on wall to hang clothes...this was literally hanging off the wall with loose screws. The bathroom was small and not worth the extra charge. What we did like was the location. We could walk everywhere: 1313 Main for wine/cheese, Opera House, dining, etc. The first night at 2am there was a drunken fight in the room next door..we were moved to a room down the hall. This room was so much nicer, brighter, cleaner, bigger bathroom. The staff never apologized for the inconvenience I made 2 trips to office..first to complain then to get a new room. Elevator does have exposed wires..we used stairs even though we were on 3rd floor. Got back late one night and there was no parking, found street parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KD's Mommy
Reviews.Content: Check-in was bizarre. The desk clerk bounded out of the office and was very very loud and shouty (in a friendly way). When he realized we were from England he started asking silly questions about the Queen and Diana. Then, at about 10.15pm he phoned the room to ask us who we were! We could be forgiven for thinking that he was 'high'. A previous reviewer referred to a 'stoned desk clerk'. However, he was helpful. The room was adequate, we only stayed 1 night. It was clean and the bed comfortable The walls were very thin, you could hear conversations in the next room and toilet flushing etc. The hairdryer didn't work. The hotel was within walking distance of several really good restautants. The town of Napa looks very new. we had an elderly relative with us who had been before some years ago and did not recognize it. We visited Sonoma and that was authentic, with the lovely old buildings and the town square.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl299
Reviews.Content: Service was great. However room was shabby. TV showed only black and white pictures. No amenaties such as conditioner or body lotion. Bathroom sink had hot and cold water mixed up. Could hear people in the courtyard Elevator had wires showing and was slow. Stairs were scary and did not feel stable. Hotel was good if you are just needing a place to crash and do not care to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: MarchelleP
Reviews.Content: I have been to Napa several times to go to concerts at the Napa Valley Opera House. We have stayed at the Napa Valley Hotel & Suites every time. It is in excellent proximity, just a couple of blocks, to the Opera House and to the many eateries. The rooms at the hotel are very nice, the staff are so friendly and helpful and the rooms are very affordable. I plan to stay there whenever I go back to Napa, which will be soon. Marchelle

Reviews.Title: “We like this place”
Reviews.Author: Dave K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel the last few years and as recent as 2 weeks ago. The location is great with walking distance to anywhere downtown shopping, bars and restaurants. They recently updated the rooms and we were happy with everything. The staff was really helpful and friendly.The last stay I left some personal items in the room and they called me the next day to hold them for me. This place is a real value and I only hope they have a room available next time we plan a stay in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Keith B
Reviews.Content: Came here on the recommendation of a friend and was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED by how clean and up to date the room was. Garry the manager was exceptional and helped us map out our entire day of wine tasting and had a ton of useful recommendations on 'must see' places and great recommendations on where to stop and take breaks. The location of the hotel is awesome and easy to walk to a lot of restaurants and bars. Great recommendation from the hotel on an Italian Dinner spot. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely be staying here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Wonderful stay... :)”
Reviews.Author: Antje W
Reviews.Content: I came here for a little R&R and chose this motel because of its rates. I did read some of the negative comments and decided to take my chances in spite of them and I am so glad I did! For starters the location is simply perfect. It is right in the middle of town and therefore everything is in walking distance. Now to the hotel itself. Since the rate was really low, I did not expect much and therefore was truly surprised by this little gem. Yes, it is an old motel, but it is very well kept up. My room was clean and quite up to date in style. For me service was simply excellent! From the maid service to the helpful young man at the front desk! A special thank you to Gary for the free upgrade and all his kind help during my stay! I certainly will be back...thanks again...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Louisa H
Reviews.Content: We were really surprised of how nice the room was when we arrived at the hotel. The pictures of the rooms online are old and need to be updated since the rooms have been renovated very tastefully and modern looking. The bed was very comfortable. I am very picky when it comes to beds and they are usually very hard and uncomfortable at hotels. This bed however was great I had 3 great nights of sleep on this firm but comfortable pillow topped mattress. The location is awesome, located in the middle of Napa close to anything you would want to walk to. The manager and the guy working when we got there were great. We got hooked up with winery locations were we could get free wine tastings at by showing the hotels business card. We also got a bunch of 2 for 1 so we didn't have to pay for any wine tastings. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Brasseur
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place to stay after a show at the Uptown Theater and since we needed to leave early the next morning, we didn't want to spend a fortune. Overall, we were quite pleased here. We checked in before 3:00 p.m. and asked to see room first since there were some negative reviews about cleanliness, etc. The first room we were given was clean and recently redecorated but the toilet was running. The second room we were assigned was just fine --- all new bedding, mostly new furniture, clean carpet and bathroom. It's evident that this is an older motel that is being refurbished rather than structurally remodeled. The bed was comfortable, AC worked well, good wifi. Our room was on second floor above pool and far from the elevator and stairwell and we found it quiet. What made this property work for us was the location and parking. We parked the car and walked around downtown and along the river all afternoon. We walked to a place for a glass of wine and walked out again to Oxbow Market (The Kitchen Door) for dinner. The next morning we walked back to Oxbow for Ritual coffee and a delicious breakfast at the Mexican cafe. I'd give 3 stars to the room and service, but 5 stars for the location and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommotions, excellent personnel! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: We just had a comfortable, stress-free stay with you. My reliance on a walker or scooter required special accommodations, and you provided them...more completely than other places where I have stayed. We were able to park right in front of our room, which was clean and comfortable. You were "walking" distance from a Great Italiann restaurant (recommended by your desk personnel) last night for dinner, and another for breakfast this morning; where we had really good omelettes; and we were 2 blocks from the Uptown Theatre, where we attended Esperanza Spalding's concert last night. We both really needed a get-away to de-stress, and we experienced one there in Napa. Thanks for your part in accomplishing that!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: JosephineB99
Reviews.Content: We weren't too sure because of the reviews for this hotel, but we decided to book it because it was in our price range. Checked into the hotel Friday afternoon and was greeted by the front desk clerk and the aroma in the lobby just made me feel at home. The lobby is well done and it seems like they doing some improvements to the property. When we opened up the room door, my husband and I were pretty schocked. There was new carpeting and bedding, a nice bright white sofa bed, and the sink area was clean. Bathroom fan could use a little tuning up, but overall a great product. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: amcanrer95
Reviews.Content: The Napa Travelodge is located in downtown Napa within a few blocks of some lovely attractions - the Uptown Theater, River Walk, antiques, wine bars, and dozens of wonderful restaurants. There is also free wi-fi on the premises (no pass code required). However, it is a motel built around the parking lot, making for a very noisy room. It's not a good place to sleep in late or get to sleep early. The rooms are small, minimal, and not especially clean. Better for business than pleasure or rest.

Reviews.Title: “We appreciated the friendly and great service.”
Reviews.Author: JB M
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay at the Travel Lodge in downtown Napa, we were provided friendly and excellent service by Michael G. We had a problem that was courteoustly and promptly resolved by Michael then and there, and with his follow-up service thereafter. The location of this motel is excellent, and affords guests the opportunity to easily walk to all the attractions associated with downtown Napa. We would stay at this Motel again. J.B. McClain

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel020
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed at a Travelodge before. Not sure if they are all the same, but this one was like a compound, the rooms surrounded the parking lot, which was inadequate for the amount of rooms. Booked this room several weeks ago. The usual places we stay at were not available, so we chose the Travelodge due to the positive reviews. I will begin by saying, the room itself was nicely done. Modern, with crown molding, overall the rooms visual effect was pleasing...... It was adequately clean, the ceiling above the shower needed some de-molding, and some loose change was left on top the air conditioning unit. The towels were bright white and fresh, but could have been a bit larger and plusher. There was little water pressure in the shower and we were on the ground floor. The toilet fill valve needs replacing as the tank fills at a snails pace. As for the bed, the mattress was very comfortable, however the pillows were thin and hard.The mattress sheet was flat and too small to be tucked under the mattress, and the blanket options were limited as there was either a top sheet, or an extremely thick top comforter of synthetic material. Coffee maker, coffee and hair dryer, shampoo and soap were provided. .......My complaint about this Travelodge was the location of the room we were given. Room 117. It is located in front of the postage sized pool entrance gate, and 2 handicapped parking spaces that continually were being used by other guests to unload luggage, before finding parking on the street. This room was located at a juncture where every hotel guest passed in front of to reach their room. This is also where every smoker stood and smoked their cigarettes, it wasn't necessary to open the door to smell the smoke, because a 1/2 inch gap separated the door from the floor. My biggest complaint however, Gary the manager. When approached about our horrible room location, Gary's response "did you request a second or third floor room? Then you got what you booked." Booker -- beware!

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY AND DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: critracerx
Reviews.Content: When checking in the front desk person seemed high as a kite. Then once checked into our room we found the toilet unflushed, and pubic hair all over the bathroom. I cleaned the bathroom and found the bath tub drain plugged, which explained the dirt ring half way up the tub. When I brought this to the attention of the stoned desk clerk he only told me it should drain by morning. I had a hard time falling to sleep, all I could think about was how gross this place was. It is a shame the room was so dirty. We actually love the location.

Reviews.Title: “Needed A Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: LesOntheGo
Reviews.Content: I was travelling here with my husband and we decided to take a break from all the food-hopping and decided to spend the night instead of driving back up. We chose this hotel out of others because it was in our budget and seemed nice. The room was clean, linen was fresh, and the bathroom was adequate. Couldn't have asked for a better one night stay in Downtown. If we are ever in the area again, we will definately look this place up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: JPaneer
Reviews.Content: My family and I were on our way back home when we decided to take a detour into Napa and needed a place to rest our heads for a couple nights. We looked around at other hotels but this one just fit our budget and seemed nice. Well, it was and the staff was very helpful in getting us checked in and out. They seem to really care about their customers and it shows throughout the property!

Reviews.Title: “A Business Trip That Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: VMercadoNE
Reviews.Content: I'm in town for a seminar in the burlingame area for work and I decided to have my wife meet me here and take a weekend trip up to the famous Napa Valley. One of my friends, whose from the bay area, told me about this hotel and I'm glad he did. It wasn't far from the restaurants we dined at and we had a car service that took us to some of the wineries for one of the days. Couldn't have asked for a better experience, thanks to the staff at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelA12
Reviews.Content: I booked this place a couple of weeks in advance because I had some family coming into town and wanted to stay near the restaurants/bars for a reasonable price. I've been to the area before, but never stayed here. I'm glad we did book a place and stayed at this hotel. Front desk staff was helpful, rooms were clean, and although the bathroom fan was a bit noisy, all in all it was a great place to stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “sad little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamajudy73
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and decided to try it, reasonably priced in downtown Napa. Wasn't looking for fancy but it disappointed in several areas. The first room they brought us to was behind a locked pool gate for which they neglected to give us the code and adorned by a pot filled with cigarette butts. The room was locked from the inside, so they gave us a better room upstairs. Clean and comfortable, the only problem there was the lack of handles on the bathtub - literally. Nubs which were almost impossible to use. Hotel recommended a great Italian restaurant for dinner. Breakfast was a 20% deal at a lovely place, The General Store. We got there, and they said the discount is 10% and didn't the hotel give us a discount card? They were very nice and gave us the 10% discount, even without the card. Our room had the best internet service (free) we have found in any hotel, free or not. With a little TLC this would be a great option for travelers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Riverfront and The Napa River”
Reviews.Author: HurleyOR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and had a satisfying experience, so I thought I'd come back since I had some business at the new Riverfront area and it was only a couple of blocks away. The manager (Gary) was very helpful and made everything a breeze and helped me out with some discounts at the local eateries in the area. Greatly appreciated !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for the Downtown Area!”
Reviews.Author: rhamon82
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect when I booked this place. I was travelling with some friends and it was my turn to book the room for our vacation trip. The staff was very helpful in booking the rooms and told me they would include some free wine passes! :) and setup some sort of transportation for us to the wineries of our choice. When we got there the lobby area is beautiful, it doesn't even seem like your in a travelodge, and the suite I had booked was like an apartment condo! Refrigator, full kitchen w/ a dish washer, king bed with pull out sofa beds, not to mention how clean the room was. Pictures will be up soon! Satisfied with our stay and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location & Price!”
Reviews.Author: Mdec23
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too aware of the Napa downtown area, as when I do come to Napa its more towards the wineries off 29, but I was amazed at how cute this little downtown area is! I came here for work (Napa County Civil Court-which is right across the street of this place) and fell in love with this area! The front desk clerk who helped me was very nice and very helpful in finding a great place to eat. Couldn't of asked for a more pleasing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected !”
Reviews.Author: MallieAL
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms at this hotel a month prior to staying here because some friends were coming into town from Florida and they wanted to check out Napa Valley. The front desk staff was very helpful with setting up various wineries to go to and even helped us with setting up a car to take us there!!! I will definately be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Uptown”
Reviews.Author: lgev777
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for Napa and the area. My wife and I walked everywhere (Didn't have to drive our car at all for the weekend) and there's alot of choice for food and wine, but the best part was that it was so close to the uptown theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh...”
Reviews.Author: swhlive49
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest place I have stayed at, but definitely the best Travelodge I have stayed at. The location can't be beat, it was nice taking a stroll past all of the restaurants and bars downtown. There were too many restaurants I wanted to try, but will have to get to them on my next trip to Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cjennings66
Reviews.Content: I came here with my wife, spur of the moment trip, as we live in the Bay Area. Decided to make a reservation with this hotel as I have stayed here before on business. What I love about this place is their comfy beds and customer service. Also, it helps that their located in downtown where we can go out and not have to worry about driving back to the hotel. As it is the wine country haha.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: kvlofts478
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet rooms, quiet parking lot. Great stay, thanks to Gary, Rudy, Mike & Darlene

Reviews.Title: “Great job!”
Reviews.Author: JF400
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say great job to the folks at the Travelodge in Napa Valley. Gary Dent (the manager) was funny, friendly and helpful! The accomodations were a good value and were also very close walking distance to local downtown amenities. You cannot beat the price for this location. Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Napa Marathon”
Reviews.Author: mladcani
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for food and shopping. 10-minute drive to Vintage High for the marathon. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Room was clean and nice. Recommended restaurant for "carb dinner" was fantastic. Good location for your pre-marathon run :)

Reviews.Title: “OK experience, but not exactly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CAHobo
Reviews.Content: We were there to see a Railroad Earth concert at the Uptown Theater and as we expected, there were lots of others there for the same reason. The motel is in a great location, within walking distance of good places to eat and the theater. The room was decent enough, although the blanket on the bed left a lot to be desired. Our sink stopped up and we reported it, and much to our surprise it was cleared when we got back from the show. There were lots of people partying after the show until the wee hours of the morning, but luckily our room was in a corner where there was a secured door which you had to get through to get to our room, which helped it to stay fairly quiet and also kept partiers from knocking on our door. If you're a family or someone else looking for a nice, quiet place to stay, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate and clean”
Reviews.Author: Juanita086
Reviews.Content: It wasn't as bad as the reviews! The bed was comfortable and had a nice pad; the blanket was pitiful. Looks like new crown molding and paint and bath fixtures although the shower was weak. Our two nights were pleasant and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “CAN IT BE THAT BAD? YES IT CAN!”
Reviews.Author: lwiden
Reviews.Content: 1 night in Napa RUINED thanks to Travelodge! I'm not a big complainer - often stay at Motel 6 with no problems. After switching rooms 5 times 5th room - finally getting one where the TV works and there are splatters (blood??) and the ceiling is not caving in (actual holes!) we gave up. NOT clean, had to lay towels over the furniture to sit down, 1 glass and 1 coffee cup (there were 2 of us) stains and holes in the comforter (had to remove it completely). By this time the dinner we brought to eat in was ruined (crazy eating in, but wanted to bring back several of our favorites from Oxbow!), we were tired of picking up and moving again, and my husband REFUSED to try yet another room. WiFi does NOT work! No lighting in elevator area - to use your room key for the elevator you could NOT see the slot and then when you enter the elevator the license had expired 10 months ago! Is this what they mean by "Stay close to adventure!"????? PLEASE do NOT stay here - should have listened to the bad reviews. BTW - I did email both corporate and the hotel directly to see if there was any validity to all the complaints - surprise! NO response. This is not what you think of when you think Napa!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in room and service. However, you can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: hineikin15
Reviews.Content: The gentleman who was in charge of the front desk was less than friendly. The walls are also paper thin and you might want to bring earplugs to drown out your neighbors. We soon discovered our drain in our shower did not work and our tub filled up with a bunch of gunk out of the drain. It was disgusting and wouldn't drain. We came in on a Friday night and were not able to check into a new room until Sunday night. It was very hot this weekend so needless to say going without a shower for two days was not very exciting. When we checked out on Monday the front desk person credited a measely 32.00 which was supposed to make up for it???? He didn't even credit us for HALF of one night and then blew us off when we asked to speak with a manager and said we would have to call them tomorrow and that they would not call us. The nice part about staying here was the convenient location. That was it. Bottom line: There are other places to stay downtown. Don't waste your money on this kind of service. Especially if you get stuck with a bathroom that isn't even functioning!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: undergrounds
Reviews.Content: You reall ywant to access a coupon from www.Roomsaver.com to get the price down below $80. That said, this is a great deal because that coupon will save you $50. The rooms are ok, the location is great and it's worth considering a second time. The Desk Mgr was extremely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Decent clean basic accomodations; bad service”
Reviews.Author: smartcooki
Reviews.Content: We were going to a wedding in Napa in the middle of August (high season) and needed to find a place to stay/crash for 1 night. Napa is notoriously expensive, especially in the middle of the summer and on the weekend, and finding something without a 2-night minimum over a weekend is very difficult. The cheapest places were all in the $145-150 range after taxes. Then I bid on Priceline and the best deal I got was this Travelodge for $128 including taxes. Since there were two of us, I called and tried to request a room with 2 beds. When we arrived, there was no such request noted. The front desk person is also rude. He proceeded to argue with me that my rate included ONLY a room with a double bed and that's it (not even a queen or a king). The whole situation was unpleasant and left a bad taste in my mouth. I should mention that I called two other times with questions and both times the person on the phone was short and rude. Customer service doesn't seem to be a priority here. When it comes to the room itself, it was perfect for our needs (except the part where we had to share a double bed). The mattress is actually very comfortable. The TV works. The bathroom is small, but clean. The shower was definitely weak. But the room overall was very clean for a basic motel. It's not a fancy place by any means, but if you're looking for a basic clean and inexpensive place to stay/crash (for Napa), this is a good convenient option right in the center of Downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Old style new memories”
Reviews.Author: flaxprt
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times although the desk service seems consistently lost the rooms are clean and your within walking distance of downtown which is a must after the wineries close

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: d.dowse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, nearing the end of a two week road trip around CA , NA, AZ. This was without a doubt the worse hotel we stayed in. I can only discribe it a dingy, the room was tiny, and you could only just about walk around the bed, the bathroom was without a doubt the smallest I have ever seen, it put both of us of ever visiting napa again. The only good thing about it was the location, which was in the centre of the town, and within walking distance of all shops and restaurants. But if I had the choice again, this is definately not one Id choose.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeri_R_G
Reviews.Content: Spend the extra money and choose another hotel. This place is disgusting, I do not need to stay at the Ritz but this place was a dump. Rude staff, dirty room, did not get the room we paid for and did not give us a refund on the difference even though they admitted it was their fault and they overbooked rooms. We arrive half hour before check in and they would not let us use the bathrooms on site and told us to go somewhere else for a bathroom or wait till our room was available. Room stunk, stains on furniture (disgusting stains!), would not put my stuff on floor because the room was so gross I thought that there were probably bugs. I read reviews of others and I cant believe the postive things people wrote, they are either used to staying in dumps or they are not being honest for what ever reason. We stayed one night and then moved to another hotel that we paid a lot more for and was further away from town, totally worth what we paid to move to another place ! One positive is the location DIRTY shame that the hotel is so nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: beballer007
Reviews.Content: I came here over the weekend with my wife, as a little getaway from home, and its just what we needed. The staff was very well mannered and they even serve popcorn as an afternoon snack! You can't beat this location, i recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Napa”
Reviews.Author: mrfd1979
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find somewhere affordable to stay in Napa, so were pleased with the price and location of this motel (check discount websites as good offers available). Like any Travelodge, the rooms and amenities were basic but functional. Thin walls and ceiling so noise travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: shock43
Reviews.Content: We had to switch rooms three times because of various things missing or not working. Only one ice machine in the court yard, we wound up on the third floor. Slow and outdated elevator, parking inside the court yard can be a problem. For the price charged, one should expect better, even in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Vexing Valentine's weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Inlander_WillTravel
Reviews.Content: Pros: EXCELLENT location in downtown Napa, lots of eateries and shopping within walking distance, a Wal-Mart a few blocks away to stock up on munchies and sundries; newly painted rooms, accomodating staff, comfortable firm beds, affordable; Cons: walls are so thin you can hear every BREATH your neighbors take, above your room as well as on either side!!! We were there for a four-day weekend and probably got a total of 12 hours of sleep - and that's not for lack of trying. The hotel's clientele had no regard for others in the complex and were loud and rude, in their rooms as well as in the parking area, which is in the middle of the complex... Also, we tried to check out at 4 AM on a Monday morning; no clerk was available even after ringing the bell three times, so we left our room keys in hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've been in California!”
Reviews.Author: Andrei-french
Reviews.Content: We came here as a couple and as the hotel was not full, we were upgraded in a room with chimney and Jacuzzi (the best for the bucks we’ve stayed in). The hotel was very quiet and the room perfectly clean and comfortable. The friendly staff always willing to recommend you the best vineyards in the area gives coupons for free tastings. The location is great: very close to restaurants, vineyards and wine bars in the center of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe just for a night”
Reviews.Author: veronie
Reviews.Content: This hotel might suit some people, but I won’t be going back. The location is good, allowing you to have a drink in downtown and walk home but that’s about its only redeeming feature. Our room was very small, so with two adults and two medium suitcases it was a challenge to move around. Our room also suffered from having very thin walls! We could hear everything going on in the room next door and also got woken up at 6am by the person upstairs running the shower. To be fair, it’s a cheap hotel, so you should never expect too much and I don’t like giving negative reviews. But in two weeks of travelling around California, this was the most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: mgray1988
Reviews.Content: We had just been travelling through the National Parks and Lake Tahoe and we decided at the last minute to spend a couple of days in Napa, before heading for San Fran. We had located a Value Accomodation booklet on our travels and this hotel was listed. We did not book in advance and we were greeted at reception with a friendly smile. The room was clean and was of reasonable size. It is not a five star but we did not expect that for the price we paid. This is central to most Napa attractions. We had asked them to recommend a nice place to eat, and did they come through. They sent us around the corner to this italian restuarant and it was fabulous. All in all I would rate this Hotel as a high three star. You should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good just on the surface”
Reviews.Author: sunsetd
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Saturday without reservation, so the price went up $60.00 and they gave me a room right next to the elevator, which upon check-in I did not notice yet. The room was small but looked very nice on the surface, however, there was blood on one towel, the jacuzzi bath tub was a little moldy and the toilet was plugged. At 2am some people decided to check out the pool, of course not so quietly as they were supposed to and when I asked the hotel staff in the morning they told me that they heard it, but decided to do nothing. Upon my complaint they granted me $40.00 discount which I gladly accepted. And if you find a safe inside your room which you decide not to use, you should mention it upon check-out or they'll charge the full amount. Parking can be a problem if you arrive late.

Reviews.Title: “Even better deal with coupon”
Reviews.Author: svgklingon
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect to go to Napa but because the coast was shut in with fog we decided to head inland. We had grabbed a RoomSaver publication from some tourist info kiosk and the Travelodge had a $69 coupon for a queen. We called and got a king for $89 ($10 for additional quest, $10 for king upgrade, all written on coupon) and the front desk fellow, Gary couldn't have been more accommodating, He gave us great directions, put us up in an awesome room behind a private fence next to the pool and showed us a good map and circled some nice wineries to visit. It seems all the tastings cost between $10 and $20 dollars so when you spend money on wine and food, saving some at the hotel is worth it. The room was nice and spacious enough for two. Bathroom was very clean and the internet signal, although at times was weak, allowed me to post to my blog easily enough. The location is fantastic as the other reviews say, but Napa seems to shut down about 6pm. We stayed on an Wednesday in August and after dinner (7:30 about) the town seemed like a ghost town. If your not looking for luxury, but are looking for a comfortable place to stay while cruising around Napa and Sonoma, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 16&17. The hotel was clean & had a fantastic location. If you want more - probably not the place for you. We never had a problem with parking although the lot was on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and awesome advice!”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner1985
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in Napa Valley, and this hotel was everything we were looking for! Not only did we get upgraded to the nicest suite because it was my birthday, we were also given great advice of where to visit in the area. The rooms were spacious and clean and the beds were extra comfortable. The room we were in had a large kitchen that we were to cook a wonderful birthday dinner in. The pool was small and it was well worth it in the 110 degree weather. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bumming around Wine Country? Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: WithLoveFromMN
Reviews.Content: If you are going to hunker down in a luxury room for a romantic evening, the Napa Travelodge is not where you want to stay. If the primary reason you are in the Napa Valley area to visit wineries by day, and eat at a great restaurant at night, why stay anywhere else? This Travelodge is located just a block off of Main Street. After a long day of wine-tasting, we checked in, cleaned up, and headed to Celadon for dinner, whch is a nice walk from the hotel. After dinner, we stopped at Downtown Joe's for an excellent IPA, then headed back to the hotel. The bathroom looked to be recently remodeled, and was small, but nice. Same goes for the bedroom. We got a good night's sleep and a fine shower and we were on our way! Can't ask for much more for the price. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well..... both good and bad”
Reviews.Author: KDUB7
Reviews.Content: The good: location, location, location The bad: Reservation 'system' is non-existent, and front desk personnel range from "very helpful" to "scarily clueless" My family booked two rooms at the hotel. I arrived separately, and checked in OK. Our other room, however, got sold out from underneath us (probably to the large, vocal wedding party who were also experiencing reservation issues) We had all prepaid for our visits, so the nights were already paid for. We used different sites to book, and had a difference of nearly $50 in the cost of the rooms. I challenged this and was told "I can't do anything about it, that's Hotels.com problem." Hotels.com called BS on that, and I got a credit, from Hotels.com. BRAVO Hotels.com for their customer service! The woman at the front desk did find another room for my family at another hotel, but proceeded to make a big show out of saying she was paying for it with her own credit card. WTF?? The better customer service news, though, is that my family got upgraded to a better room than the one booked, and things smoothed out after that first night. But holy smokes, this ain't no way to run a railroad, er, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Have a good day”
Reviews.Author: Skinklecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while doing a Napa Valley wine tour. We left the booking too late, and know that ending up here was our own fault. That being said, here is what made this stay a negative experience. When we checked in on Friday afternoon, there were 2 people ahead of us in the line-up. The first man had booked his stay for 3 nights and was checking out after one. He wanted confirmation that his credit card was not going to be charged. The young lady at the front desk was not able to give him what he needed. It seems the manager was the only person able to do that and he was nowhere to be found. As the customer left, unhappily, he was told to "have a good day". The second person to be helped had changed rooms. She received a new key but unfortunately, it was to a room that was occupied by someone else. She was also told to "have a good day". When we made our reservation it was online. We phoned ahead a few days before we arrived to make sure that we did in fact have 2 double beds in each room and that the rooms were connecting. Despite having these assurances, upon checking in, not only did the rooms have 1 king bed each, they were on seperate floors. When it was evident that we were unhappy, we were told to "have a good day". The rooms that we had were dirty and worn. The bathrooms had been redone and I guess that they are slowly trying to update the property. Understandably it is an expensive venture and will take time. Old does not have to mean dirty though and a good couple of hours of cleaning in the tiny room we had would go a long way. The biggest complaint that we have is the complete lack of customer service. The manager was long gone by 4pm on a Friday afternoon of, arguably, the busiest weekend in the Napa Valley and he left a young lady in charge who had obviously been told to tell each customer to "have a good day". The young man there the next day was not much better. Neither of these people seem to have any interest in their customers. That speaks directly to the management of the property. There was no effort made to accomodate any of the people that we witnessed over the course of the weekend. I would never stay at this property again and would never recommend it to anyone either.

Reviews.Title: “don't go”
Reviews.Author: buzz11
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location downtown but thats about all the good i can say about it. when we arrived we asked if they had a breakfast and internet in the room and they said yes. the breakfast was a 10% discount at a restaurant three blocks down the street. the internet does not exist they're stealing someones signal and was not strong enough to stay online. the internet is not wireless and there is no light near the desk so working would have been impossible even if the net would of picked up. teir advertising they have internet is just not true and the girl at the front desk admitted they don't have their own signal. don't get the deluxe room the bigger tv is 30 inches and the whirlpool tub is a regular size bathtub with a cpl of jets. location is very good for downtown and thats about the only good thing i can say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Served my needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: boilinginTexas
Reviews.Content: I couldn't find anything anywhere around Napa/Calistoga for under $300 until I found this. Heartened by the review from the couple who said they just needed a place to lay their head (which is me as well), I took the chance. Other than the very abrupt guy taking reservations, who quoted me over the phone $50 more dollars than listed on their website, snidely told me if I wanted the online price, then hang up and send in my reservation online. Which I did. Other than that guy, who I never heard of again, my stay was fine. It is very easy to find, very conveniently located. Although parking is a tremendous problem during the week, I imagine. There is no parking inside the place. You must park on the streets at the meters. Fortunately, I was there on the weekend and didnt have a problem. (except for hauling my suitcase around the block). The room was very clean and the furnishings looked new. The window had little shutters that overlooked the pool. And the pool looked clean. The elevator worked and the place smelled fine. It was really quite nice for the price. My only pet peeve was that the air conditioner had a short circuit. I thought it was broke, so I took the lid off, and it turned on. I jiggled the cord and it turned on and off. Sometime during the night it turned itself off, but I was so exhausted from driving, I really didn't care. The lady at the front desk was very helpful to give me a map and tell me the lay of the land, but was nowhere to be found when I checked out. I didn't need her, so it wasn't a problem. (I think she may have been shortstaffed, because she was running around getting things for various rooms.) All in all, perfectly fine and I wouldn't hesitate to stay another day or two if necessary. Certainly the best for the price in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovecawine
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful bistro style hotel with some of the extra touches that make it so special. Convenient to the Riverwalk and great restaurants. Try ZuZu for tapas and nice wines. The staff is courteous and very helpful. A delightful stay in wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased for price”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailstoU
Reviews.Content: Very pleased for the price. Located in downtown Napa. Read the reviews prior and took our chances. I don't know what other people expect for the price (we paid $118 before taxes) but definitely worth that, but we are relatively easy to please since we consider the hotel is just a place to sleep and change clothes. The location was fabulous for walking to restaurants and shops. Large grocery within a mile drive. Wonderful small town atmosphere - not stuffy like some of the winery areas. The manager was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Also the visitor's center is within walking distance and extremely informative. If you are looking for a safe, clean, reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of small quaint dining places, you won't be disappointed. Also recommend Downtown Joe's for dining and drinks and Napa Valley Roasting Co. for morning coffee and danish. The drive to the Napa wineries was about 10-15 minutes away. Also would like to suggest V. Sattui as a must stop on the winery tour. Nothing else compares for a combo of beautiful gardens, friendly staff, and food and drinks. Very, very few other wineries in Sonoma and Napa are grandfathered in as the only wineries where you can actually purchase food (cheese, crackers, etc.) The other 2 we know of are Benziger and Domaine Carneros in Sonoma but they don't come close in the food dept. (We weren't expecting that). Also you can actually purchase a bottle at V. Sattui and some wonderful cheeses and consume it on their grounds. The majority of the other wineries you can only taste and they are not allowed to sell you even as much as a glass so that was rather disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingal32
Reviews.Content: This is about the Downtown Napa Travelodge, located in Napa, California on Coombs Street. This is the worst hotel we have stayed in for many years. At a base price of $139, equally about $157 with tax, you'd be better off at a Motel 6. The room was dirty and extremely small. There were small flying bugs, the elevator wasn't working properly, and it had an odor. But, the icing on the cake was that the bathtub would not drain, and other people's hairs and other unidentifiable objects floated back up. It was a disgusting nightmare. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget motel, I don't agree with these reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Humboldtus
Reviews.Content: Perhaps this motel has gone down in quality since we stayed there a few years ago, or perhaps I should not rely solely on what TripAdvisor members say. We stayed here for 3 days as a base for exploring Napa and the Napa valley. In short, we did not encounter any rude staff, grime, or bed bugs. Also, I remember the neighborhood to be quiet, and had no problems with parking. The rooms are simple, but ours was clean and tidy. The motel is in a great location--walking distance from a nice outdoor shopping mall, the river and a great riverfront "general store", and their self-guided walking tour. Check this place out before listening to all the negativity.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: thepun
Reviews.Content: I think Travelodge is of great value. Jenni (hope my spelling was right) was very helpful a the check in. We reserved 4 rooms and there were all clean when we moved in. I would stay there again next time I visit Napa.

Reviews.Title: “horrible..never stay at a Travelodge again!”
Reviews.Author: DJKsar
Reviews.Content: Booked this because it was the cheapest hotel I could find that was available 2 weeks before my stay. Check-in was fast but the room was another issue. Here are my compliants about the room: -bed sheets were not comfortable and were as rough as a porkypin. -bathroom was dirty and moldy in spots -toilet flusher would get stuck and would have to manually fix it -very noisy due to street and parking lot noise throughout the night -phone vmail wasn't working I guess the moral of the story is if you look for a cheap hotel you definitely are getting to get the cheap quality too. Don't bring your significant other to this hotel cause they will think you are a cheapskate. If you can afford $50 more look for a B&B or another higher-rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: supertraveler33
Reviews.Content: We are currently in room 207, very very SMELLY, from the minute I entered the room, let me see, where to start, the hot/cold mis labeled, took a while to figure out the shower, calcium build up on shower head, VERY VERY noisy hotel, street sweeper woke me up at 3:45am colud not sleep for 4 hours then the garbage truck and all it's noise there, then the next door neighbor decided to let the world know he was up. So if you go here to sleep, pick up another hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Hair dryer bring your own, ours broken in room

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but pretty clean and the location is incredible...”
Reviews.Author: alita
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I was pretty scared to stay here and even thought about forgoing the money I had spent on Priceline and staying somewhere else. However, when we got there, it didn't look too bad. The exterior looked like it had just been painted and it was in the middle of downtown napa! The parking area didn't look too full but it was the day before Thanksgiving so I don't think there were too many people staying there. The guy at the front desk was really pleasant and he gave us a map of the area and said if we need anything to call down. I went into the room and immediately had my friend help me lift up the mattress (I told you I read the reviews before and I was scared the place was infested with bedbugs). But the mattresses looked fairly new and no bugs! the room/bed is definitely only built for two though, so if you are planning on trying to squeeze four people into the room, good luck. Two of you will need to sleep on the floor next to the bathroom/sink/closet space/desk area by the door. The bathrooms looked pretty clean and my only complaint were the towels were a little worn and some of them didn't look like they had been washed very thoroughly (one of the washcloths looked like it still had a lipstick on it and one of the bath towels had a brown mysterious stain) I only noticed it in the morning after i had thankfully used a clean towel but I'm sure if I called down, they would have bought me some new ones. The location is the best though! I mean, all the restaurants i had read up on were in walking distance, (check out cole's chop house and uva trattoria) and it was next to the little downtown center with a cool little indie bookstore. If you're looking to hang out at the motel/hotel all day, hang out by the pool (it was tiny and i didn't even look at it very closely) and watch tv (worked at night but in the AM didn't work at all, strange) and relax, this is not the place to go but if you just need a central place to store your bags and sleep, it's not bad. I mean, i have seen worse. I think it might just be a combination of it being a little older and just the number of people who probably pass through all the time. Oh! and if you're one of those people who worry about security, they have two entrances (that i could see) one was the elevator and the other were stairs but both needed a key card to access the top floors. (it kinda made up for the fact that our door didn't have one of those super locks on it, it looked broken off) so overall, it was a pretty clean, very centrally located, easy to find, parking was good (but again maybe because of the holiday), somewhat secure, maybe a little rundown/worn but a passable place to stay for one night or two nights. if i went onto priceline and found out I had to stay there again, i wouldn't be so worried. (but i would still check for bugs...you can never be too sure!)

Reviews.Title: “Hated this place”
Reviews.Author: jvn777
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! It's more like a dirty motel than a hotel. From the outside, it looks decent with new paint but parking is very limited and the layout out of the parking lot is awkward. My boyfriend's opinion of the room - "It's like the type of place you rent by the hour". The stench of mustiness and chlorine hit me the moment I opened the door. The smell was so heavy that I had a hard time sleeping that night and breathe at the same time. The coverlet of the bed was filthy and covered with stain. Needless to say, I removed it from the bed. The wall is paperthin. The bathroom is disgusting and small. Mold spots covered the bottom of the shower curtain and a crusty ring of calcium buildup was on the shower head. I have to take another shower again that day after checking out and checking in to another hotel. Parking space is limited and I don't think the location really matters much - downtown Napa is so sleepy. (Where was everyone?) This is a regrettable purchase from Priceline and I wouldn't stay here again even if it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to go home with bedbugs!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLuvr1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and we didn't realize it had any problems until the second day when my boyfriend woke up with itchy bug bites. At first, we thought they might be spider bites and discounted it because we were enjoying our trip but by the time we got back home, they were itching like crazy and covering his body! He had to take off work, pay to go to the doctor, and pay for medicine. Now, a week later, I have bites on my skin (apparently this can be common, some people may take 1-2 weeks for bed bug bites to show up). We are disgusted and now have to worry about whether or not we brought the bedbugs into our previously clean, uninfected apartment through our luggage. When I called Travelocity to request a refund, they said they could only give me a $50.00 discount good towards my next Travelocity purchase! I called the hotel to let them know what happened (so that other people would not have to go through the same thing), and the manager DID NOT EVEN APOLOGIZE! He only told me that they could not compensate me in any way since I went through Travelocity and told me "thank you for letting him know." I had initially told him what room # I stayed in (very quickly, I don't think he wrote it down), and he never asked for it again. I got the feeling that he wasn't going to do anything about it for new customers. Terrible Customer service. I will never stay at a Travelodge again!

Reviews.Title: “Has the basics for your trip to Napa”
Reviews.Author: Deedee95070
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Travelodge Napa was like a trip back in time, sort of like the motels my parents took me to in the 50's. I wish it had cost $9.95, the price my parents paid. Would have been worth $49 in most locations, but price = >>$200. To put things in perspective, there are nice hotels in the Napa Yountville neighborhood that cost >$600, so it was a super bargain for the location and anyway Yountville was sold out. Travelodge was clean and OK, nice people, just shabby. Location terrific, we walked to my favorite Napa restaurant "Uva Trattoria" with local jazz band starting at 8:00 on Saturday night. Travelodge is truly in a super location, short drive to all the Napa wineries, walking distance to Napa Opera House prime entertainment, Copia, Wine train and all else that Old Town Napa offers. Just don't expect ambience in your room. I will be more honest and specific. Even the remote didn't work.:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing special, but a good buy.”
Reviews.Author: trip_seeker-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night next to the pool. It was functioning but not able to be swam in due to pool cleaning gear being left in it the entire time. The gate to the pool kept banging shut all night and it was 10 feet away from our window so we heard it. Most likely not a problem for most guests in other parts of the hotel. The staff was super friendly the entire time. No problems with the room or anything else. Overall I think it was too much to pay for the place. I think we paid like $140 but it is located in downtown Napa so that's probably where the price comes into play.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Motherosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel bordered on "acceptable" There was a group of us that stayed here due to a wedding nearby. The rooms on the first floor looked more "worn" - than the rooms on the 3rd floor. We had a room on the 3rd floor - the bathroom was clean and the tile looked new. The bed had a little "sag" look to it but was comfortable. The pullout couch is definitely for only one person. Parking is limited as we had to park on the street. There was some confusion regarding rates - as we were to be given a special prearranged rate due to the wedding. People were charged all different rates. We were supposed to get gift baskets from the bride and groom delivered to our room - but for some reason we asked about them at checkout. The girl at the desk was very pleasant and tried to be helpful, but there seemed to be a lot of confusion between staff. If you don't get an exceptionally lower rate than other hotels in the area, I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you're OK with a MOTEL, this is a great location and price”
Reviews.Author: CassidyCarmichael
Reviews.Content: I booked about a month in advance, and got a rate of $88/night for a Fri and Sat night. We had a queen room on the 2nd floor, in an area where there is not a 3rd floor (i.e.: no one above us). The location, as others have mentioned, is awesome. We also appreciated the free, covered parking. The walls are admittedly not thick, so we could hear some sounds at night - but it truly wasn't bad. In fact, we were delighted with what we got for the price. We used our savings to go toward other extravagances - ballooning, wine tasting, fine meals, mud baths and massages. We weren't in the room much, and the bed was comfortable, room was clean, TV worked and the shower was great. In short, it met our needs. For anyone expecting luxury, I don't think any motel, including a Travelodge, is the way to go. For a bargain hunter willing to forego frills, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Overpriced Dump!”
Reviews.Author: BUZZAlison
Reviews.Content: Hi: This is my second stay at the Napa Travelodge. My first stay was back in 2001 before the place was remodeled and still called a motel. At that time it was a walk-in rate of 55.00 a night with a King bed, very basic, but in reasonable condition. The Travelodge is in a wonderful downtown location with all the great restaurants, COPIA and the wineries conveniently located nearby. The Mustard Festival at the Copia on that particular weekend was my primary reason for booking this Travelodge. For this stay, I booked on-line 2 months in advance (January) with some assistance from the Travelodge front desk. I needed two rooms, one with a king and the other with a queen for a friend traveling with us. The reservations online showed only queen beds but I knew otherwise from my past visit. I called the Travelodge directly after making the reservation and was assured by the front desk person that they could make adjustments in-house to the reservations and not to worry. They (local Napa Travelodge) had problems with the on-line reservations not showing accurate information about the actual rooms that were available at that site. Two weeks before our stay, I checked to make sure the reservations were valid and had the correct rooms listed. Everything looked ok. On March 17th, We checked in. On the reservation were two queen beds. There was no reference made for a king bed. My husband is 6' 5". A king bed at a hotel is a necessity, not a luxury in his case. My friend's room was fine for her needs. I was livid that all the planning that I arranged was in vain. A complete deception. I demanded to speak with the manager. He acted like I was crazy because no such arrangement existed on the computer, in his world. I was also told that no other rooms were available, the hotel was completely booked. I knew we would be billed for the rooms whether we took them or not. I demanded that we be given a king room at the rate I was given. I was told that none was available. Finally, the desk clerk relented and offered us a King suite. The rate was 149.00 a night, not the 109.00 rate agreed on the phone with the the desk clerks previously. I consented and took it. At this point, there was no other choice. I was still going to be charged for the rooms whether I took them or not. Given the fact that it was St. Patrick's Day weekend in sunny Northern California, it seemed to be the only option other than driving back home. The so called "suite" (#307) had maintenance problems. The bathroom door was stuck to the point that it was difficult to open or close due to a sloppily fitted door jamb. A torn, slightly mildewed, shower curtain with ill-fitting and missing shower rings served as the barrier between shower and floor. This curtain looked like it was ready to be used as a painting dropcloth, it was in such poor condition. Water leaked through the curtain due to a centrally placed hole. The curtain kept falling down due to the limited no. of rings (5 rings- 12 holes), spraying additional water. The hot/cold tub faucet was mislabeled. The water pressure was low and the shower head was difficult to adjust. The fan didn't work, however, it looked like the light on the fan worked but the fan was never connected. The sink was remodeled recently and tiled in granite. The granite was sealed incorrectly and had stains. The coffee maker was broken. Cheap styrofoam cups were in the room, just like a Motel 6. The towels provided were worn out and stained. The room interior had worn, dirty carpets and signs of dry rot around the bay window. When the right side of the bay window was opened, the panel fell off. My friends room (#209) had stains on the furniture and the towels in her room were in similar condition. All this for 149.00 and 99.00 a night. If you are planning to visit Napa, please AVOID this hotel. It's so tempting due to the ideal location. For 149.00 a night, check out the Silverado or the Hilton Garden Inn. These places are not downtown, but you won't get swindled like I did. Chablis Inn has a king suite for 99.00 a night, another great option. You can do better. Downtown Napa needs a better hotel than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Management - Reserve at Your Own Risk”
Reviews.Author: trishatravels
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay at the Napa Travelodge for a weekend (Friday and Saturday nights) with family coming in from Boston, but had to cancel on Thursday evening when their flight was cancelled due to unsafe weather conditions. The Napa Travelodge, unfortunately, has a 48 hour cancellation policy--and they Really mean it. No refunds (understandable), but they also will not allow you to apply cancellation fees to future stays at the hotel. I tried to reason with the hotel manager who had his mind set that the policy is a policy--no exceptions. Ok, fine for my situation--it wasn't life and death. But then the hotel manager related the story of how he refused to make an exception for a traveler who had to cancel a reservation due to a death in the family. Ouch. A family member just died, they're grieving and preparing to go to a funeral of a loved one, and you wouldn't cut them some slack? Sounds like bad karma (and bad business) to me. Sure, a policy is a policy, but the world isn't black and white. Or maybe it is at the Napa Travelodge. Moral of the story? Reserve at your own risk--the management (refer to other reviewers' posts for more on them) is ruthlessly and heartlessly after the almighty dollar at the Napa Travelodge. Either purchase travel insurance or be prepared to part with your money.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! Loud! Broken! Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gotitall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a special family occasion. In the late evening, when all the young adults finished wine tasting, they partied in the courtyard parking lot all night until 5AM! We got NO sleep! They talked/laughed/sang loudly all night! They smoked cigarettes and pot right near our door so we could smell it all night and listen to them swear. We called the night manager all night, but there was no answer to help. We ended up calling the police3 times to clear the parking lot. My husband was afraid to go out and ask them to leave. When we got up in the morning, there was barf and beer bottles and cans all over. Our car and others had been sprayed with what we hoped was alchohol. When we asked the manager for a refund, he just said that if we didn't like it, then we should have moved in the night!!and didn't give us one. This stay ruined our whole weekend. Never stay here. The TV and clock radio did not work and the carpet and bedspread smelled musty and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tonyBlockIsland
Reviews.Content: This was not our first stay at the Napa Travelodge and we will stay there again. The location is great -- you can walk to any of Napa's restaurants and shops with ease. The rooms are clean and the staff friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and nice place”
Reviews.Author: KCMcColorado
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a week, and the location couldn't have been better. We got a discount rate for off-season. The nearby Gillwood restaurant was a great place for breakfasts, and we could walk anywhere in central downtown, even for mini wine-tastings. The room was basic, but better than we expected. Especially the staff were very friendly and accommodating for our requests for extra towels, pillows, etc. It was also quieter than we thought it might be. Plenty of world-class restaurants a short stroll away. We'd stay here again, for sure.

HotelInfo.Name: Napa Valley Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 853 Coombs St., Napa, CA 94559 (Formerly Travelodge Napa Valley)
